body:
Just to get your opinion about to make `separator: nil` behave like `separator: ''`:

```diff
--- a/actionview/lib/action_view/helpers/text_helper.rb
+++ b/actionview/lib/action_view/helpers/text_helper.rb
@@ -150,7 +150,7 @@ module ActionView
       def excerpt(text, phrase, options = {})
         return unless text && phrase

-        separator = options.fetch(:separator, "")
+        separator = options.fetch(:separator, "") || ""
         phrase    = Regexp.escape(phrase)
         regex     = /#{phrase}/i

diff --git a/actionview/test/template/text_helper_test.rb b/actionview/test/template/text_helper_test.rb
index bc1b1bb..f3fd369 100644
--- a/actionview/test/template/text_helper_test.rb
+++ b/actionview/test/template/text_helper_test.rb
@@ -314,8 +314,8 @@ class TextHelperTest < ActionView::TestCase

     options = { :separator => "\n", :radius => 1 }
     assert_equal("...very\nvery long\nstring", excerpt("my very\nvery\nvery long\nstring", 'long', options))
-
-    assert excerpt('This is a beautiful morning', 'a', separator: nil)
+    assert_equal excerpt('This is a beautiful morning', 'a'),
+                 excerpt('This is a beautiful morning', 'a', separator: nil)
   end

   def test_word_wrap
```
